definition: broadcast/CL:個|个[ge4]/broadcasting/to broadcast/(formal) to propagate/to publicize
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

pinyin: Ying1 guo2 Guang3 bo1 Gong1 si1
Mei3 guo2 Guang3 bo1 Gong1 si1
Zhong1 guo2 Guo2 ji4 Guang3 bo1 Dian4 tai2
Mei3 guo2 Quan2 guo2 Guang3 bo1 Gong1 si1

definition: Beijing Broadcasting Institute, former name of 中國傳媒大學|中国传媒大学[Zhong1 guo2 Chuan2 mei2 Da4 xue2]
pinyin: Bei3 jing1 Guang3 bo1 Xue2 yuan4
Ge1 lun2 bi3 ya4 Guang3 bo1 Gong1 si1
Zhong1 yang1 guang3 bo1 dian4 tai2
Ying1 guo2 Guang3 bo1 Dian4 tai2

definition: Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC), Australian state-run broadcaster
pinyin: Ao4 zhou1 Guang3 bo1 Dian4 tai2
Zhong1 guo2 Guang3 bo1 Gong1 si1

sentences.english: The four-letter words were always edited out of radio scripts until quite recently.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近廣播稿中的庸俗詞語才讓保留下來。

sentences.english: So, apps such as Pandora internet radio can be listened to while reading the news using another app.
sentences.chinese: 例如你在閱讀新聞的時候同時收聽潘朵拉網絡廣播。

sentences.english: Some stations broadcast 24 hours of the day.
sentences.chinese: 有些電臺一天24小時廣播。

sentences.english: Station WRC is off the air now. They signed off two hours ago.
sentences.chinese: WRC臺現在沒節目了，它在兩個小時前結束了廣播。

sentences.english: We validated next generation radios for cars at General Motors.
sentences.chinese: 我們驗證了下一代車輛的無線廣播系統。

sentences.english: We now bring you the full text of the Renmin Ribao editorial.
sentences.chinese: 現在全文廣播《人民日報》社論。

sentences.english: This program is beamed at Russia.
sentences.chinese: 這套節目是對俄羅斯廣播的。

sentences.english: The BBC plans to televise all Shakespear's plays.
sentences.chinese: 英國廣播公司計劃播放莎士比亞的全部戲劇。

sentences.english: We should focus on rural radio and television coverage by the extension to the family.
sentences.chinese: 要着力推進農村廣播電視由村村通向戶戶通延伸。

sentences.english: He often talks on the radio.
I know radio began by restoring the ancient art of storyteller .
sentences.chinese: 我知道，廣播的開始是藉助於說書人這種古老藝術。

sentences.english: BBC reporter saw a column of smoke rising from the area.
sentences.chinese: 英國廣播公司記者看到，從該地區煙柱上升。

sentences.english: All radio programs are available on cassette format.
sentences.chinese: 所有的廣播節目都以盒帶形式發售。

sentences.english: Many car radios are fitted with RDS (radio data systems) which carry local radio reports.
sentences.chinese: 許多車載廣播臺都配有報告最新路況的電臺。

sentences.english: He used the new medium of radio to do so directly.
sentences.chinese: 他利用新的廣播媒體直接向國民發表演講。

sentences.english: And when I am on-air, I play music that sounds good.
sentences.chinese: 當我在廣播裏的時候，我播放好聽的音樂。

definition: to issue (an order, decree etc)/to send out/to dispatch/to produce (a sound)/to let out (a laugh)
regular column or segment (in a publication or broadcast program)/program (TV or radio)
speech sounds/pronunciation/colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character/phonetic/audio/voice/(Internet) to voice chat/voice message
